instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.ADPATER_EN: What is ADPATER_EN? This is a typo of SMC_ADAPTER_EN When you see ADPATER_EN, assume they meant to type SMC_ADAPTER_EN.
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, many problems
threads.message:
hdd connector ripped off the board pads pulled, connector replaced jumpers ran
wifi connector ripped off the board pads pulled, connector replaced jumpers ran
now no green light
this is a strange one because over current protection circuit seems fine, nothing looks particularly fucked up, some of the case grounding springs ripped off
are N/C pads actually ground? and why are there caps which are NC on both side?
diode mode measurements from probing caps
 <CAPACITOR>C8942</CAPACITOR> 0V 7ohm
<CAPACITOR>C1756</CAPACITOR> 0.04v 133ohm
<CAPACITOR>C2493</CAPACITOR> 0v 14ohm
<CAPACITOR>C2401</CAPACITOR> 0.004v 14ohm
<CAPACITOR>C7722</CAPACITOR> 0.08v 240ohm

ppbus 12.6V
pp3v42 3.478

this has been here at the bottom of the pile for 2 months now, its time for me to fix it or bin it

threads.message: changed adapter have green light, dont have battery, 3.32v@<RESISTOR>R3222</RESISTOR>, is your board view for this one messed up?

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, many problems
threads.message: was using 85w magsafe 2, this only worked on some boards, now using 60w magsafe L <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> @<RESISTOR>R5085</RESISTOR> 3.396V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, many problems
threads.message: Need to be using an 85W charger for 2915, not 60W. Shouldn't affect your green light, but still won't power board on without battery, etc.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, many problems
threads.message: Ok I understand about the wattage but won't power on without a battery? Why?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, many problems
threads.message:
I think SMMRepair means since you are using a 60w charger, the only way the board would power on is with a charged battery.
If you use a 85w charger, you will be fine, no need for battery.
I use only 85w with magsafe 2 adapter and so far so good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, many problems
threads.message:
that makes sense because the board can draw more current with a battery attached, thanks, I was using the magsafe 2 but getting a green light was a bit hit and miss due to the connector being a bit larger

now changed to 85W magsafe L
